hints.content:
To find how tall the $\blueE{\text{tomato}}$ and $\maroonD{\text{pepper}}$ are together, we need to find the total.  So, we add.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/c098ac1dfc38a39a08d23355121032094ed1eca9)

$\blueE{32}\text{ inches}  + \maroonD{29}\text{ inches} =\purpleD{\square}\text{ inches}$

Let's add to find the total.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/0313d9f2b10643efc17529e0b2a8b521739da6e1)

$\blueE{32}\text{ inches}  + \maroonD{29}\text{ inches} =\purpleD{61}\text{ inches}$
The tomato and pepper plant measure $\purpleD{61}\text{ in}$ combined.

question.content:
Tony measures the height of each of his plants.  

Plant | Height  
- | - | -
Tomato | $32 \text { in}$ 
Pepper | $29 \text { in}$ 
Corn |  $72 \text { in}$ 

**What is the height of Tony's tomato and pepper plant combined?**  

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] $\text{in}$
